Row.Text: No Civilization is selected for this role.

This common preset is intended for the standard Barbarians Evolved experience. Barbarians will evolve and capture cities, and present a serious threat to your Civilization. You can fight off the fall of Civilization, or play as the Barbarians and bring it to pass!

This preset is a twist on the Barbarians Evolved experience. Given time, Barbarian Encampments will evolve into City States - if you let them. City States assimilate Barbarians that invade their territory. You cannot play as Barbarians nor have the Barbarian Civilization in your game.

This preset is intended for experienced mod-users that are using a DLL mod, such as the Community Balance Patch or Vox Populi. Barbarian city capture, healing and upgrade are all assumed provided by the enhanced DLL.

This preset is intended for players who would like some Barbarian enhancements, but without the risk of them redefining the game. Camp evolution, city capture and State-Sponsored Encampments are completely disabled. Barbarians take on a harassment role.

Your worst nightmare comes alive. Barbarians are replaced by ravenous aggressive undead. They do all the things Barbarians used to - and worse, like ignore terrain costs. Units they kill both heal them and join their ranks. This threat can and will redefine your game.
Causes the mod to act conservatively, disabling a number of features if the Barbarian civilization is not present.
Defines whether Tribal Barbarian units heal 10hp per turn in their own lands (which includes Encampments).
Defines whether Tribal Barbarian units spawn in defense of Tribal cities.
Defines whether Tribal Barbarian units spawn in defense of Barbarian Civilization cities.
Defines whether Tribal Barbarian units spawn in defense of your cities when YOU are the Barbarian civilization.
Defines whether Barbarians spawn in State-Sponsored Encampments.
Defines the global chance for Barbarian units to spawn in garrisons and camps. Suggestion: use your preferred game difficulty level.
Defines whether Barbarian Encampments evolve into cities. If you selected the City States preset, they will evolve into City States first, and Barbarian cities once no more City States can evolve.

Defines the number of turns between each Encampment evolution into a city.[NEWLINE]Quick game speed uses this value as-is.[NEWLINE]Epic and Marathon multiply this value by 3.[NEWLINE]Standard and other (modified) gamespeeds multiply this value by 2.

Some mods crash when cities are spawned from nothing. This option causes the Evolution action to spawn a Settler unit instead, which resolves the crash. Depending on your mod setup, the Settler may wander or settle in-place.
Defines whether Barbarians are allowed to capture cities.
Defines whether Barbarians must have a melee unit in proximity in order to capture a city.
Defines whether two obsolete Barbarian units are upgraded into one modern unit.
Defines whether two obsolete Barbarian units are upgraded into one modern unit when YOU are the Barbarian civilization.

If valid, defines the Civilization to which Barbarian cities may be liberated.[NEWLINE]A common complaint with Barbarians Evolved was that capturing Barbarian cities incurred a Warmonger penalty. This allows you to pre-define a 'victim' Civilization to which cities will be spawned then 'captured' by the Barbarian civilization, allowing for Barbarian cities to be Liberated.

Defines whether liberated Barbarian cities (owned by the Liberation Civilization) are dispersed on the next turn.[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]WARNING:[ENDCOLOR] This means whoever the liberation target is, they can never hold a city longer than one turn before it is erased from existence.
Defines the Major Civilization to which the Tribal Barbarians are allied.[NEWLINE]This Civilization will be the recipient of ALL Tribal city captures and Encampment evolutions.
Add Barbarian Civilization to This Game
Place the specified Barbarian Civilization into the game in the first AI slot. You can always add it or remove it in the next screen if you change your mind.

Set your civilization as the Barbarian Civilization. [NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]WARNING:[ENDCOLOR] Removes the Barbarian AI player, as only one player can be the Barbarian Civilization at any given time.
Defines the set of Barbarian land unit promotions. Promotions must be uppercase string identifiers separated by commas.
Defines the set of Barbarian naval unit promotions. Promotions must be uppercase string identifiers separated by commas.
Defines the set of Barbarian sea unit promotions. Promotions must be uppercase string identifiers separated by commas.
Defines whether Barbarians change names as the eras pass. This causes a performance hit.
Defines whether the name change performance hit is deferred until the Tribal Barbarian turn just before the new turn.
Defines the set of Barbarian names, descriptions, phrases and camp words used in each Era.
Defines whether the construction of State-Sponsored Encampments is allowed at all. If unchecked, State-Sponsored camps are instantly converted into Forts.

Defines whether the construction of State-Sponsored Encampments is allowed for Non-Barbaric Civilizations. If unchecked, State-Sponsored camps are instantly converted into Forts for Non-Barbarian Civilizations.
Defines the maximum number of Infiltrator units that can be in play or under construction at one time (for the Barbarian Civilization).
Defines the maximum number of Enslaved Worker units that can be in play or under construction at one time (for the Barbarian Civilization).
Allows you to change or redefine the color palette used by the Tribal Barbarians.
The Era to which this row of strings applies.
The singular phrase used to describe hostile elements in this Era.
The underlying cause of hostile elements in this Era, such as Barbarism, Rebellion, Insurgency, etc.
The plural used to describe hostile elements in this Era.
The description of a hostile spawning point in this Era.
The entity to which this color panel (RGBA) applies.
The color panel for the Tribal Barbarians; these wander the map in the early game.

The color panel for the Barbarian Civilization; this only applies to the default Barbarian Civilization provided with Barbarians Evolved and will not override any other Civilization's colors, if selected.
The Barbarians' most basic early-game naval Unit.

Infiltration tactics emerged gradually during the later years of World War I. Infiltrators are most potent when they unleash a Dirty Bomb. The purpose of the Dirty Bomb is to contaminate the area around the dispersal agent/conventional explosion with radioactive material.

An Infiltrator is an extremely powerful unit. Unlike an Atomic Bomb, the Infiltrator can move from the city in which it is built and advance towards a player-owned city. It can attack a target within its range of 2 tiles, but is not permitted to attack tiles if the subsequent fallout would catch Barbarian allies. When the Infiltrator unleashes it's "dirty" Atomic Bomb, a 2 tile blast radius is afflicted. Units within the blast radius are damaged or possibly destroyed, and cities will be severely damaged. The Infiltrator is automatically destroyed when it attacks in this manner. See the rules on Nuclear Weapons for more details.

Unleash nuclear destruction upon your foes. Does great damage to Cities and damages any Unit caught in the 2 tile blast radius.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires Manhattan Project, but unlike the Atomic Bomb which it replaces, the required Uranium can be scavenged from black market trades, meaning the resource is not required for construction.

Reject Settlers, wonders, trade and more, in favor of glorious WAR! Pay no [ICON_GOLD] Unit Maintenance and suffer no [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness. Inherit cities and technology from your Barbarian ally. Undead variation can cross all terrain.

Who are you? It doesn't matter. Your name is a symbol; your identity a figurehead, a rallying cry. Your people rose from rubble and will leave rubble in their wake.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] You are the leader of those that civilized folk call "barbarians". The Barbarians are a rabble who care not for the trappings of society. Living day to day, they range from place to place, destroying all in their path.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Mighty leader, your people long for a glorious tyrant to give direction to their strength. Can you crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and hear the lamentation of the women? Can you bring down empires that have stood the test of time?

Another actor who struts upon the world stage and dares to call themselves civilized. Wrap yourself in the flag of nationhood and trappings of dignity while you can.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]WARNING: They will declare war on you next turn.[ENDCOLOR]

The shadow you see on the horizon is the dust of my troops and the ashes of destruction left in their wake. Your time shall end, soon.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]WARNING: They will declare war on you next turn.[ENDCOLOR]

At last, we are acknowledged! How civilized! Now then, with the obligatory exchange of pleasantries over... get out of my sight.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]WARNING: They will declare war on you next turn.[ENDCOLOR]

You think you have defeated us? You will never defeat us! No matter how safe you believe yourself to be, one of will always emerge from the fog of war to strike back![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]WARNING: They will declare war on you next turn.[ENDCOLOR]
You have disabled construction of a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_EVOLVED_CAMP]State-Sponsored Encampment[/LINK] in this game. If you build one, a Fort will be constructed instead.

+50% [ICON_STRENGTH] Defensive Strength for any Unit stationed in this Tile. Within a city's reach, these act as Forts. Built far enough away, they act as training grounds for Barbarians. If left alone long enough, they may evolve into a city.

+50% [ICON_STRENGTH] Defensive Strength for any Unit stationed in this Tile. Within a city's reach, these act as Forts. Built far enough away, they act as training grounds for Barbarians. If left alone long enough, they may evolve into a city.
It will improve the [ICON_STRENGTH] Defense of any military unit stationed in this tile, may spawn Barbarians, and may even evolve into a city.
Can traverse mountains and ice, and end a turn on mountainous terrain without taking damage.
